#summary Overview of Tmix in ns-2
#labels Featured

=Introduction=

Tmix for Full-TCP has been included in the standard codebase of ns-2 since [http://sourceforge.net/projects/nsnam/files/allinone/ns-allinone-2.34/ ns-2.34] (June 2009).

Tmix for one-way TCP has been included since 
[http://sourceforge.net/projects/nsnam/files/allinone/ns-allinone-2.35/ ns-2.35] (Nov 2011).

Documentation - [http://nsnam.isi.edu/nsnam/index.php/Manual:_Tmix:_Internet_Traffic_Generation Tmix in ns-2 Manual]

= Details =
Example (same code can be found in tcl/ex/tmix/ directory of ns-2.34 and later)
  * [http://code.google.com/p/tmix-ns2/downloads/detail?name=test-tmix.tcl test-tmix.tcl]
  * [http://code.google.com/p/tmix-ns2/downloads/detail?name=sample-alt.cvec sample-alt.cvec]

Validation
  * Tmix using ns-2 Full-TCP and Tmix using ns-2 one-way TCP validated against the original trace and Tmix replayed in UNC's testbed
  * [http://code.google.com/p/tmix-ns2/downloads/detail?name=ns2-lossless-sep2010.pdf ns2-lossless-sep2010.pdf] - no packet losses simulated
  * [http://code.google.com/p/tmix-ns2/downloads/detail?name=ns2-lossy-sep2010.pdf ns2-lossy-sep2010.pdf] - packet losses simulated
  * Note: One-way TCP used all 500-byte packets, whereas Full-TCP can use variable-sized packets (max 1460 bytes)
